Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the officer conduct an inadequate analysis of the best interests of the child impacted by the decision?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under IRPA subsections 72(1) and 72(2)(b)
Evidence_Type: Evidence of child's establishment in Canada
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Best interests of the child, humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to adequately analyze or articulate the child's best interests and suffering from separation
Crimes.Application_Factor: Establishment of child in Canadian school
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of permanent residence on H&C grounds
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Inadequate consideration of best interests of the child
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Matter referred to a different officer for redetermination
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Missing documentation on childâ€™s academic and psychological well-being
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Officer failed to be alert, alive, and sensitive to child's best interests
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging unreasonableness of decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider mandatory factors in H&C assessment
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to declare or assess relevant hardship and dependency factors

Crimes.Violation_Type: Unlawful presence due to overstaying temporary resident visa
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer's decision to deny permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds was reasonable?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant faced abuse in Grenada, established life in Canada with Canadian-born son
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and reassessment of H&C application
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Decision found unreasonable and set aside
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Temporary resident who overstayed visa, mother of Canadian citizen child
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized stay
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations, including family ties and risk of harm upon return
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Best interests of the child, hardship upon removal, history of abuse
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Inadequate analysis of best interests of the child
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's claims of abuse and establishment in Canada accepted as credible
Evidence_Used: Evidence of abuse in home country
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds under s. 25(1)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Officer acknowledged some evidence but inadequately weighed it
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Permanent residency based on H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer overlooked key hardships including family abuse and economic challenges post-removal
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of physical and emotional harm to applicant and child if removed to Grenada
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed her visa and sought permanent residency based on humanitarian grounds, citing abuse history and ties to Canada
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None directly; procedural failure in application of s. 25(1)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Incomplete evaluation of submitted hardship evidence
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliance with visa conditions due to overstaying
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Insufficient hardship evidence cited, despite strong countervailing factors
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider all relevant evidence on hardship and best interests

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the officer adequately analyze the best interests of the child in the H&C application?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under IRPA s. 72(1) and (2)(b)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Best interests of the child, emotional and financial hardship
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Child's emotional dependency on the applicant and potential suffering upon separation
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to distinctly and sympathetically assess best interests of the child separate from general hardship
Evidence_Ignored: Likelihood child would leave Canada if mother deported
Crimes.Application_Factor: Child is Canadian resident, deeply established in Canada
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Work permit and H&C application refused
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Inadequate consideration of best interests of the child
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Case referred back for reassessment by different officer
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Officer's inadequate consideration of the child's best interests in an H&C application
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider evidence of child's likely departure and hardship
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Officer failed to give proper weight to mandatory considerations under s. 25(1)
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review on grounds of unreasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to conduct distinct and thorough analysis of child's best interests
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to consider emotional and financial consequences of separation
